description:
I have had a simple search for a Logitech driver for Linux turn into a 5-hour-long nightmare with me mumbling, "...just HAS to be...even a generic Logitech-Linux (Deb/Ubuntu/Mint) driver SOMEwhere! " I began to feel like someone with a bad gambling problem who keeps saying, "Come on, baby...I can feel it...THIS will be the Jackpot!" as they put another coin in. Before that, I had to really, REALLY make sure that I had just about killed the Touchpad and any relations to it. I used to HATE it when I was typing something and all of a sudden, windows disappear, workspaces flip and flop, etc., because while the USB Mouse is working just fine, the Touchpad kicks back on for reasons maybe not even L.T. himself would know. Ok, that is stretching it...Linus not know anything about something happening on L I N U X?!? But you got my meaning, anyway. Sorry, Mr. Torvalds. No offense meant.
~MJC
summary: Awesome app that is MOST welcome after my... "searches" for drivers!

description: Just bought a Logi MX Ergo and installed Solaar. Doesn't do much yet but I can see the battery level. That's cool.

Found my old k750 solar and wanted to try it out on Ubuntu. Sadly i did not find the right unifiying reciever and was at a loss on how to solve this on Linux. This app saved me, very simple and works great. Thanks alot!

Thanks to the two previous reviewers that posted their experience. I installed Solaar and immediately noticed a difference in how the mouse was responding. It made the trackball and on screen mouse move smoother across the screen. I'm using the Logitech MX ERGO PLUS Wireless Trackball. 

System: MSI B450i motherboard /Ryzen 2600 CPU /16GB DDR4 / XFX Radeon 550 4GB

That is, a smaller footprint than lgitech's software for other OS's, as they don't officially support linux distro's, at least so far as this software goes. That said, bravo! This software fills that gap. Very cool project, done well. (However! the manual build/install is a bit finicky--could be improved.)
summary: works seamlessly, with a smaller footprint.

description: Ubuntu 19 just wont pair bluetoot devices for me so I got a recomendation on stack to try this with my dongle... And it just worked instantly! Lovely!
Works really fine
It Works...I smile
I could set up my receiver and connected device in few seconds just by following the simple guiding messages.
summary: Easy to use and helpful messages

description: I can connect this mouse to my windows laptop just fine but for some reason, the app can't detect it
summary: Seems great but I can't connect my mouse

description:
I don't want to see the Solaar UI pop up each time I use Logitech devices.
I get an error each time I plug in Logitech after I've uninstalled
No issues using logitech on ubuntu
The window just kept opening up every minute when autostarted with ubuntu.
summary: Kept popping up every minute or so

description: I love it, this should be the official logitech app
Outstanding. This is how software should work.
summary: It installed and worked without a problem

description: Works very well and actually gives me battery condition for my mouse and keyboard.

Works exactly as intended. Could use a little bit of usability polish when you don't have a mouse to click on stuff. Tabbing around in the interface with a keyboard doesn't seem as directly obvious as it could be.
summary: This tool is perfect for managing Logitech Unifying devices

description: Whilst it doesn't do anything, I have to give it 2 stars since it does launch
Very good app for easy GUI to see all the required information.
summary: Nice app, let me to see the battery left of the device

description: i love this app just what i need it even better than the unifying software on windows.
awesome app, works well with MX keys and MX master 3...
summary: this app saved my day! top work!

description: Worked like a charm.
It works great on my platform, thank you!
What are you doing Logitech
What more do I need to say?
I was able to get my K800 keyboard working with it. Thanks!
No fuss. Installed, run, and we're good to go.
Solaar made my logitech USB mouse work after upgrading my distro. It may require a computer restart.
summary: Fixed my mouse after upgrading to 18

description: Easy to use, works as expected.

I installed this and it wouldn't work with my receiver, initially. Eventually, it said that it saw a receiver but couldn't connect, and that I should unplug-replug. I tried that and it didn't work, so I uninstalled Solaar. After a couple days, I decided I was going to make it work even if I had to dig down a bit. I reinstalled, it gave me the unplug-replug advice. I did this immediately, with that windows still open, and it worked! It shows battery percentage, encryption status of the connection, and even lets me "Swap Fx function" on my K780.
the correct Url of project is https://github.com/pwr-Solaar/Solaar
I lost my dongle yesterday and was hoping this could be a solution. Wrong. This is no negative review, but unfortunately, I have an ACER mouse. I'm sure its a great program. 5 Star, why not
summary: I was looking forward to it

description: Let me easily turn off the special fn keys on my K400 and repair devices. Thank you.
Pairs the off market unifying receiver with standby keyboard mouses perfectly. Simple pairing process you can ask for. Good work team.
Great app.Makes a Performance Mouse work
It doesnt open on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS
thanks , logitech m510 v2 works well
unusable with two devices connected on the same USB dongle
summary: it doesn't work, constantly resets the connection

description: I'm not sure why this doesn't have 5 stars, this works perfectly for all Logitech Unifying Receivers and compatible devices. It has already saved me a ton of time and/or money trying to find or purchase new devices to match the lost dongle.

It would be really nice if this were able to assign keyboard combinations to my mouse buttons like the windows version can. Still, I'm glad to see this exists, and hope they're still working on more features!
summary: Hope they're still working on more features

description: I was surprised to find how well this worked. When I moved over to Ubuntu I was worried that my mouse might not work great but things were seamless with Solaar.
No problems. It installed without problem and works flawlessly. It also gives the battery charge of each attached peripheral. Nice!
summary: Great app for Logitech Unifying peripheral

description: i was looking for an ubuntu app that could pair logitech mouses and recievers, and this was what i found. good app, but it can be buggy with non-unifying logitech products, and the battery signal on my m705 only goes up to 90% instead of 100% with brand new batteries. hoping to see more features in the future, especially button mapping
summary: very glad this exists so i don't have to deal with windows

description:
Set up a desktop comp w a used Dell with some performance enhancements under the hood. My old machine died, did ot want new for my needs and was not about to app to Microsofts bottom line. Have runn Ubuntu for 2 years with a wired kb and mouse. My logitech wirwless sat because my atemps at set up fail.
Then came acrossa referance to Solaar.
Immediately loaded Solaar and set up the peripherals.
! Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful !
Works beyond my expectations.

Thank You for such a useful app!
Works better than Logitech's bloatware.
Does exactly what I want it to do

Not even in windows I could have all my devices in 1 application: keyboard and mouse.
Just super! 
I only cannot find the possibility to customize buttons
I am running Lubuntu
This was an easy find, easy intall, and works just as well as the Logitech-published version on macOS or Win10. Working with my new MXKeys and my old and trusty M305 mouse.
Huh. Well that was super useful.
summary: Whoa, a linux driver solution that just works

description: I googled for a solution and found a listing for Solaar. I wondered if it was in the snap store for Ubuntu. To my suprise, it was. I installed it and paired my mouse and keyboard to the receiver all in less than a minute.
Allowed me to get wireless usb profile stored into my M720 triathlon. once you pair all 3 to bluetooth your kinda locked out of wireless dongle without software. This fixed. Fantastic.
It just worked, turning a night of reading forums into a night of actually getting things done.

￼
I can now use my MX master on my Xubuntu using the dongle Thanks
summary: Working with MX Master on Xubuntu

description: Works perfect for G502 and Powerplay mat
summary: Works perfect for G502 and Powerplay mat

description: Manages my devices with ease.
Devices are auto configured with labels like "new" with no ability to rename. No other issue. Love it!
Worked as advertized to re-pair my Logitech unifying receiver.
Not only is the app super useful and works to the full extent available in the hardware, but the support is super efficient end helpful. What more could you ask!
summary: One of the very best apps on the internuts

description: Works beautifully. Straight forward install.

So I had an M710 Keyboard and an M705 mouse that I lost the USB Transceiver for sometime ago. I bought a new ERGO K860 keyboard from Logitech, and used Solaar to add the two older devices to the new USB transceiver that I got with my new keyboard and ... it worked like a charm! Shout out to Daniel! Thanks bro!
summary: Worked for 3 of My Bluetooth Logitech Devices

description: I have a Logitech MX Keyboard and a Logitech M705 Mouse and the app displays the battery strength of each device perfectly. This app isn't as functionally complete as Logi Options with my Windows 10 laptop, but it provides the necessary status I desire. Both devices are used with Linux Ubuntu Mate on a 2014 Mac Mini (Mac OS has been replaced with Linux).
Was trying to change mouse speed over the settings limit with no success - until i found this app.
Thsi version is out of date. Latest version is 1.0.6 as of todays' date. Having a bug with 0% battery on mouse when plugged in. Didn't realize it's not updated.
summary: Out of Date, bugs with this version

description: Big improvement over the default settings on Ubuntu but lacks the customization you get from the actual logitech software. Still until Logitech supports Linux this is the best there is. Thanks for the app

my Keyboard K380 finaly connected 
thx a lot!

Paired both my MX Master 3 and my MX Keys to the same receiver.
Would be nice to be able to configure the other buttons as well.
I like it better than the windows tool
Really great piece of software that brings some much needed functionality out of the logitech mice!
The install instructions should have informed user that a hwe kernel would be installed along with the software.
summary: Installation adds hwe version of the ubuntu kernel

description: A simple tool to handle your "Unify" needs. Works like a charm with my various MX mices. It's simpler than the official Logitech tool on Windows which is great.
thx god it exists
Works as intended, allows to do what advertised
summary: Great application for managing Logitech devices

description: version 1.0.1 GUI does NOT work. it hangs when started thought CLI version can get the right results.
summary: removed this version. reinstalled Solaar 1.1.1 instead and works

description: Doesn't work for a Logitech G700 mouse!
worked immediately to connect to mouse and keyboard

It's a simple little applet that lets me manage my unifying receiver devices (e.g. pair a new device, remove an old device, view stats, and even control some features). 

I've only got one very minor annoyance and that's that it notifies every time a device comes on or off and separately notifies battery level each time. My trackball lasts a few days once the 10% threshold hits, but it notifies me multiple times per day regardless.
summary: Does what it says on the tin

description:
Works better than the
Logitech software on
Windows.
Lumbuntu 20.04
summary: works well and is easy to use

description:
icon is the same as for my laptop battery and it's confusing. also useless as i have no idea which of my devices it's indicating. i would rather just have the solaar icon and then battery status on the drop-down.

other than that it works like an absolute dream. i have three devices connected on one unifying receiver.

i know i'm a fringe case but i have the same keyboard in two layouts and would love to add the option to rename devices locally in the future.
Nice to have this to enjoy have 2 devices on the same usb bluetooth
summary: Nice to have this to enjoy have 2 devices on the same usb bluetooth

description:
Messagebox: "Found a Logitech Receiver (...) but did not have the permission to open it. If you've just installed Solaar, try removing the receiver and plugging it back in" (closebutton)
- Remove the receiver
- Plug in receiver
- Message as above and so on
It took me 30 seconds to setup my logitech mx master 2s mouse and mx keyboard.

Easy install.
May have to unplug and re-plug the USB Unifying receiver at start up.
After that fully functional and problem free.
Kudos to the developers.
Thanks! Helped me pair my mouse+keyboard
No fuss nice job
I am quite Happy to be finally able to use MX keys and Master 3 using the unifying receiver ! Thank you a lot ! ;-)
really like it for a little while anyway needed it for the function key swap.
Was able to pair keyboard and mouse with no issues. Thank you!

surprisngly good. on linux you mostley get scond class expirence
not with this one

Its very straightforward and intuitive to use. I was expecting much more of an uphill battle and instead got done with connecting everything in less then 3 minutes. Didn't have to chase down drivers or anything else. Will be using again and again.

Had a spare unifying receiver and a M705 marathon mouse i needed to pair.
It unpaired existing devices from the receiver and paired the mouse immediately without any problems.
Great app!

I've got a few logitech devices; it doesn't allow to set mouse wheels but it is very helpful to swap FN key. 
Great work.
So far it works great. Soon I will test it with other devices.
Macht das was es soll.

Jedes Mal wenn die Maus nach etwas Stillstand wieder bewegt wird, kommt ein Popup (in Ubuntu 18.04) dass die Maus wieder da ist. Das nervt einfach, weshalb ich Solar wieder deinstalliert habe.
Die Software bietet mir auch keinen Nutzen. Das einzige ist dass sie mir den Akkustand anzeigt. Den allerdings doppelt, und zwar mit 2 verschiedenen Ständen: aktuell einmal 50% und einmal 90% . Ich habe aber nur eine Maus. Vielleicht weil ich sie mal an verschiedenen USB-Ports angeschlossen habe? So oder so: Der Nutzen eine Software zu haben, die nur eine Größe ausgibt, diese aber widersprüchlich, ist Null.
summary: Nervt die ganze Zeit mit mit Popups, Akustandanzeige fehlerhaft

description:
Nach dem herunterladen, startet es überhaupt nicht.
Nutze Ubuntu 18.04.
Weder über Terminal noch über "Ubuntu-Software".
Schade kein Start möglich.

Ich wollte meine Logitech Tastatur an den Unified USB der Maus einbinden, habe es letztendlich auch geschafft. Allerdings ist die Benutzerführung sehr schlecht, irgendwie ist es plötzlich gegangen. Macht also was es soll, aber keine Ahnung warum :-)

Hab bisherige Kombo Maus M215 und Tastatur K330.
Dann habe ich neue Maus M325 angeschafft , die ließ sich problemlos hinzufügen!! Das Programm tut was es soll! Prima!

Gesucht und gefunden. Geniales Teil.
Funktioniert prima. Vielen Dank.
es gibt eine 1.11 version, die im software center ist veraltet und von 2013.
trabaja exelente, puedo conectar todo. es compatible con cualquier raton logitech que tiene la estrellita de color naranja. exelente herramienta. yo uso linux ubuntu.
summary: la aplicacion es necesaria para el raton logitech

description: Aplicacion necesaria para raton de logitech

For years I have used it. This software allows Gnu / Linux users to use and configure Logitech devices, something the manufacturer has not wanted to do. Thousands of thanks.


Por años la he usdo. Permite a los usuarios de Gnu/Linux usar y configurar los dispositivos Logitech, algo que el fabricante no ha querido hacer. Gracias Solaar.
Con la vesión 21.10 se cuelga
In my case, I'm having problems with Bluetooth receiver (https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/1859592). Pairing keyboard and mouse with Unifying was my solution.
summary: Works well with Logitech MX Keys!

description: manque plus qu'un design évolutif mais c'est secondaire
Fonctionne parfaitement, sobre et efficace.
Facile d'utilisation. Fonctionne très bien.
Une application simple qui fait le job, bravo
summary: Une application simple qui fait le job, bravo

description:
Dans la liste des "device", le nom n'apparait pas, mais ma souris M235 2nd gen fonctionne.
De plus, à l'installation de Solaar, il est indiqué qu'il ne sera as mis à jour du fait qu'il est propriétaire.
Dommage!
summary: A bien reconnu ma souris M235 logitech mais ne la nome pas

description:
Tellement content de trouver ce type d'application sur cet environnement...

Fonctionne parfaitement. Merci !

PS : le % de ma M570 annonce 85% mais apparaît en rouge. Est ce que c'est conçu à l'envers ?
Cette application est parfaite pour configurer une souris ou un clavier mais donne la mauvais charge (dans le rouge tout le temps même si les piles sont fraîches.
summary: Parfait pour activer mauvais pour évaluer la charge

description: 5 линуксоидов из 5

За пару минут перерегистрировал свои устройства (M510, K330) на новый приемник.
Единственное замечание. Два приемника отображаются с одинаковыми именами, что немного сбивает.
Отображает подключенную мышь и позволяет настроить её параметры.
Можно отобразить заряд и на один приемник повесить несколько устройств
